memberdef.definition: PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver
memberdef.argsstring: (ConstSpline2D coeff_alpha, ConstSpline2D coeff_beta, Mapping const &mapping, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound const &spline_evaluator)
memberdef.name: PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver

briefdescription.para: Instantiate a polar Poisson-like solver using FEM with B-splines.

parameterdescription.para: The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The mapping from the logical index range to the physical index range where the equation is defined.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $(r,\theta)$.
A class describing a mapping from curvilinear coordinates to Cartesian coordinates.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::compute_singular_elements
memberdef.argsstring: (ConstSpline2D coeff_alpha, ConstSpline2D coeff_beta, Mapping const &mapping, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound const &spline_evaluator, Kokkos::View< double **, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const values_csr_host, Kokkos::View< int *, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const col_idx_csr_host, Kokkos::View< int *, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const nnz_per_row_csr_host)
memberdef.name: compute_singular_elements

briefdescription.para: Computes the matrix element corresponding to the singular area. ie: the region enclosing the O-point.

parameterdescription.para: The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The mapping from the logical index range to the physical index range where the equation is defined.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $(r,\theta)$.
A 2D Kokkos view which stores the values of non-zero elements for the whole batch.
A 1D Kokkos view which stores the column indices for each non-zero component.(only for one matrix).
A 1D Kokkos view of length matrix_size+1 which stores the count of the non-zeros along the lines of the matrix.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::compute_overlapping_singular_elements

memberdef.name: compute_overlapping_singular_elements

briefdescription.para: Computes the matrix element corresponding to singular elements overlapping with regular grid.

parameterdescription.para: The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The mapping from the logical index range to the physical index range where the equation is defined.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $(r,\theta)$.
A 2D Kokkos view which stores the values of non-zero elements for the whole batch.
A 1D Kokkos view which stores the column indices for each non-zero component.(only for one matrix)
A 1D Kokkos view of length matrix_size+1 which stores the count of the non-zeros along the lines of the matrix.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::compute_stencil_elements
memberdef.argsstring: (ConstSpline2D coeff_alpha, ConstSpline2D coeff_beta, Mapping const &mapping, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound const &spline_evaluator, Kokkos::View< double **, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const values_csr_host, Kokkos::View< int *, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const col_idx_csr_host, Kokkos::View< int *, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const nnz_per_row_csr_host)
memberdef.name: compute_stencil_elements

briefdescription.para: Computes the matrix element corresponding to the regular stencil ie: out to singular or overlapping areas.

parameterdescription.para: The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The mapping from the logical index range to the physical index range where the equation is defined.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $(r,\theta)$.
A 2D Kokkos view which stores the values of non-zero elements for the whole batch.
A 1D Kokkos view which stores the column indices for each non-zero component.(only for one matrix)
A 1D Kokkos view of length matrix_size+1 which stores the count of the non-zeros along the lines of the matrix.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::operator()
memberdef.name: operator()

briefdescription.para: Solve the Poisson-like equation.

detaileddescription.para: This operator returns the coefficients associated with the B-Splines of the solution $\phi$.

parameterdescription.para: The rhs $ \rho$ of the Poisson-like equation. The type is templated but we can use the PoissonLikeRHSFunction class.
The spline representation of the solution $\phi$, also used as initial data for the iterative solver.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::operator()
memberdef.name: operator()

briefdescription.para: Solve the Poisson-like equation.

detaileddescription.para: This operator uses the other operator () and returns the values on the grid of the solution $\phi$.

parameterdescription.para: The rhs $ \rho$ of the Poisson-like equation. The type is templated but we can use the PoissonLikeRHSFunction class.
The values of the solution $\phi$ on the given coords_eval, also used as initial data for the iterative solver.

memberdef.definition: double PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::get_matrix_stencil_element
memberdef.argsstring: (IdxBSRTheta idx_test, IdxBSRTheta idx_trial, ConstSpline2D coeff_alpha, ConstSpline2D coeff_beta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound const &evaluator, Mapping const &mapping)
memberdef.name: get_matrix_stencil_element

briefdescription.para: Computes the matrix element corresponding to two tensor product splines with index idx_test and idx_trial.

parameterdescription.para: The index for polar B-spline in the test space.
The index for polar B-spline in the trial space.
The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $ (r, \theta) $.
The mapping from the logical index range to the physical index range where the equation is defined.

simplesect.para: The value of the matrix element.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::init_nnz_per_line
memberdef.name: init_nnz_per_line

briefdescription.para: Fills the nnz data structure by computing the number of non-zero per line. This number is linked to the weak formulation and depends on $(r,\theta)$ splines. After this function the array will contain: nnz[0] = 0. nnz[1] = 0. nnz[2] = number of non-zero elements in line 0. nnz[3] = number of non-zero elements in lines 0-1. ... nnz[matrix_size] = number of non-zero elements in lines 0-(matrix_size-1).

parameterdescription.para: A 1D Kokkos view of length matrix_size+1 which stores the count of the non-zeros along the lines of the matrix.

memberdef.definition: static KOKKOS_FUNCTION IdxRangeQuadratureRTheta PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::get_quadrature_points_in_cell
memberdef.name: get_quadrature_points_in_cell

briefdescription.para: compute the quadrature range for a given pair of indices

parameterdescription.para: The index for radial direction
The index for poloidal direction

simplesect.para: The quadrature range corresponding to the $(r,\theta)$ indices.

memberdef.definition: static KOKKOS_FUNCTION double PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::weak_integral_element
memberdef.argsstring: (IdxQuadratureR idx_r, IdxQuadratureTheta idx_theta, EvalDeriv2DType const &test_bspline_val_and_deriv, EvalDeriv2DType const &trial_bspline_val_and_deriv, ConstSpline2D coeff_alpha, ConstSpline2D coeff_beta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound const &evaluator, Mapping const &mapping, DField< IdxRangeQuadratureRTheta > int_volume)
memberdef.name: weak_integral_element

briefdescription.para: compute the weak integral value.

parameterdescription.para: The index for radial direction.
The index for poloidal direction
The data structure containing the derivatives over radial and poloidal directions for test space.
The data structure containing the derivatives over radial and poloidal directions for trial space.
The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The mapping from the logical index range to the physical index range where the equation is defined.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $(r,\theta)$.
The integral volume associated with each point used in the quadrature scheme.

parameterdescription.para: $ \theta $ index.

simplesect.para: The corresponding indice modulo $ \theta $ direction cells number

briefdescription.para: Define a polar PDE solver for a Poisson-like equation.

detaileddescription.para: Solve the following Partial Differential Equation

As finite element basis functions we will use polar b-splines which are divided into two types: 1) Basis splines that can be written as a tensor product of 1d basis splines ("non-singular B-splines") 2) Basis splines that cover the centre point and are defined as a linear combination of basis splines of type 1 ("singular B-splines")
(see in Emily Bourne's thesis "Non-Uniform Numerical Schemes for the Modelling of Turbulence in the 5D GYSELA Code". December 2022.)

parameterdescription.para: The radial grid type.
The poloidal grid type.
The type of the 2D polar B-splines (on the coordinate system $(r,\theta)$ including B-splines which traverse the O point).
The type of the 2D (cross-product) spline evaluator.
The full index range of $ \phi $ including any batch dimensions.
